Don‚Äôt Make Me Think! - Series Intro

2018, Sep 08    

With web development getting more and more popular by the day thanks to the massive influx of javascript frameworks and design tools, I think it‚Äôs important not to loose track of one important area: web usability.

Simply put, web usability is the ease of use of a website. Your web or mobile app may work great, but if it isn‚Äôt easy to use, people just won‚Äôt use it.

According to Fast Company, usability is a must-have for optimal return on investment with new technologies. Companies focusing on user-experience (UX) and user-interface design in product and application development create better solutions, improving revenue, loyalty, and market share. Apple has shown that consumers are willing to pay a premium for products that are easy to use.

Numerous industry studies have stated that every dollar spent on UX brings in between $2 and $100 dollars in return.

So, with all this in mind, I‚Äôm beginning a series today, going through Steve Krug‚Äôs classic - ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Make Me Think! A common sense approach to web usability‚Äù. I‚Äôll be posting a summary of each of the 12 chapters of the book here on this awesome community, one chapter a day.

Stay tuned, we‚Äôll be building a better web one day at a time for the next 12 days! üéâüéâ
